title: Spaceflight increases aging: NASA study finds blood-forming stem cells at risk
description: A NASA-funded study reveals that space travel may accelerate aging by impacting blood-forming stem cells. Analysis of stem cells from International Space Station missions showed reduced regenerative capacity, DNA damage, and accelerated aging. These findings highlight potential risks to astronauts' long-term health, including compromised immunity and tissue repair, emphasizing the need for protective strategies.

Jumbo challenge: Tata Electronics build elephant-proof barrier in Assam
description: In a remarkable blend of technology and nature, Tata Electronics' ambitious semiconductor plant in Assam encounters an unexpected challenge: local elephants. These majestic creatures pose a risk to the precision manufacturing of chips. To address this, authorities are constructing a sturdy 'elephant-proof' barrier, with the support of the state. Furthermore, wildlife experts are safely relocating snakes discovered in the area.

title: Democracy under attack, Election Commission failing to ensure free polls, says CPI leader D. Raja in Kerala
description: Inaugurating delegates’ conference during CPI State meet in Alappuzha, D. Raja, referring to Bihar, says people’s right to vote is being ‘snatched away’

description: Meta and ByteDance's TikTok sued the European Commission after they were hit with a supervisory fee of 0.05% of their annual worldwide net income to cover the EU executive's cost of monitoring their compliance with the Digital Services Act

title: France unrest: Over 200 held, bus set on fire - What triggered 'block everything' protests?
description: France is currently experiencing widespread protests fueled by public anger towards President Macron's government. Demonstrators clashed with police, blocked roads, and set fires in major cities, leading to over 200 arrests. The unrest stems from austerity measures and political instability, with unions and activists demanding change and further action is expected, raising concerns about continued disruption.

Why British horse racing has shut down nationwide for the first time in history
description: British horse racing faces disruption. Jockeys, trainers, and owners strike against a proposed tax hike. The government plans to raise remote betting tax to 21 percent. Racing bosses fear job losses and income reduction. Brant Dunshea leads the campaign against the tax. James Murray defends the tax rise, citing online gambling growth. The strike impacts all British racecourses.

The iPhone 17 is priced from Rs 82,900, making it cheaper than its predecessor, while the Pro models are more expensive.

UAE: Emirates ID renewal and replacement in one step, check key details
description: The UAE has simplified Emirates ID renewal and replacement for citizens through a new single-step process. Under the Zero Bureaucracy Programme, applicants now only submit a form and pay the fee, with validity auto-assigned based on age. The system removes non-essential fields and is accessible via the ICP website and app, streamlining the entire customer journey.

description: Nepal faces turmoil as Gen Z protests against government corruption and censorship led to violence, forcing President Ramchandra Paudel and Prime Minister KP Sharma Oli to resign. Protesters vandalized property, attacked leaders, and even set fire to homes, resulting in casualties. The unrest escalated after social media was blocked, transforming Kathmandu into a battlefield and shaking the nation.

'100% tariff': Trump asks EU to impose higher duties on Russian oil buyers India, China
description: US reportedly considers increased tariffs on nations buying Russian oil, including India. Donald Trump suggests tariffs of 50-100% on buyers like China and India. Trump wants the EU to act alongside the US. Discussions involved US and EU officials, plus Ukraine's prime minister. This comes as Trump said he looked forward to speaking with PM Narendra Modi soon to resolve trade barriers.

title: Nepal burns: Oli shrugged as a schoolgirl was hit by neta’s car; Gen Z saw themselves in her
Woman 'raped' at Singrauli railway station; forced to travel 300km to file FIR
description: A 25-year-old woman was allegedly raped at Singrauli railway station while her husband was away. Due to the absence of a female officer, she traveled 300 km to Katni to file a report. An officer from Jabalpur recorded her statement, leading to the arrest of the accused, Devlal Saket, who is now in judicial custody.

title: Bihar polls: Tej Pratap tours brother Tejashwi’s constituency; barbs fly
description: A political rivalry simmers as Tej Pratap Yadav, Lalu Prasad's elder son, distributed flood relief in his brother Tejashwi's constituency, Raghopur. This action follows Tejashwi's visit, where he inquired about residents' well-being. Tej provided essential supplies and medical assistance, subtly criticizing Tejashwi for a perceived lack of engagement.

title: Google tightens AI use: Coders face strict rules; external tools prohibited
description: Google is mandating its software engineers to exclusively use internal AI models for coding, driven by CEO Sundar Pichai's call for AI adoption to maintain competitiveness. Employees are expected to demonstrate AI proficiency, potentially influencing performance reviews and career advancement.

title: 'Phillies Karen' identified & fired after taking Harrison Bader home run ball from young fan
description: During a Phillies vs. Marlins game, Harrison Bader's home run ball was caught by Drew Feltwell, who gifted it to his son Lincoln. A woman demanded the ball, sparking outrage online and earning her the moniker "Phillies Karen." Despite mistaken identity claims involving Leslie-Ann Kravitz and Cheryl Richardson-Wagner, the woman's true identity remains unconfirmed.
